identificationModule.briefTitle: Registry of Deep Brain Stimulation With the VERCISE™ System: Vercise DBS Registry
identificationModule.officialTitle: Registry of Deep Brain Stimulation With the VERCISE™ System: Vercise DBS Registry

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
The purpose of this registry is to compile characteristics of world-wide outcomes for the use of Boston Scientific's commercially available Vercise DBS System in the treatment of Parkinson's disease.

The utilization of Image Guided Programming (IGP), and other commercially available programming features, used as planning tools for the programming of patients with Boston Scientific's Vercise DBS System are also evaluated.

Additionally, the utilization of the DBS Illumina 3D feature that may be used for the programming of patients with Boston Scientific's Vercise DBS Systems is also evaluated.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
The purpose of this registry is to compile characteristics of world-wide outcomes for the use of Boston Scientific's commercially available Vercise DBS system in the treatment of Parkinson's disease.

Subjects' improvement in disease symptoms and overall Quality of life will be assessed during the study following DBS and compared with baseline. Additionally, the utilization of Image Guided Programming (IGP) when used as a planning tool for programming of patients is also evaluated.

armGroups.label: Parkinson's disease
armGroups.description: Subjects with Parkinson's disease who will receive Vercise DBS for deep brain stimulation.

interventions.name: Deep Brain Stimulation (DBS)
interventions.description: Subjects receiving Deep Brain Stimulation (DBS) for the treatment of their Parkinson's disease symptoms will be offered participation in this registry.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Improvement in patient's quality of life (QoL) during the study as compared with baseline
primaryOutcomes.description: Change in quality of life assessments during the study as compared with baseline

otherOutcomes.measure: Change in parkinson's disease symptoms as determined by UPDRS scores during the study as compared with baseline
otherOutcomes.description: Change in patient's motor symptoms as determined by UPDRS during the study as compared with baseline

otherOutcomes.measure: Change in medication usage during the study as compared with baseline
Impression of change scores during the study as compared with baseline
otherOutcomes.description: Impression of change scores during the study as compared with baseline

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Key Inclusion Criteria:

* Meets criteria established in locally applicable Vercise System Direction for Use
* At least 18 years old

Key Exclusion Criteria:

* Meets any contraindication in the Vercise System locally applicable Directions for Use

Subjects with significant cognitive or psychiatric impairment may be excluded in the evaluation of GXT.
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Patients with symptoms of Parkinson's disease that are not adequately controlled with medication
